Description: Three cylindrical clay beads, lightly fired. One of them is slightly thinner and quite flat, in diameter than the other two. Slightly irregular with an uneven surface. Made of fine Nile clay. All of them perforated along their longitudinal side.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.13A, level 2/3, D14.17B, D14.18
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
